1. **Delta Air Lines**: Delta offers a wide selection of movies, TV shows, music, and games on their seat-back screens. They also have a mobile app that allows you to stream content to your personal device.
2. **Virgin America**: Virgin America's in-flight entertainment system, RED, offers a wide range of movies, TV shows, music, and games. They also have live TV and a selection of on-demand content.
3. **Alaska Airlines**: Alaska's entertainment system, Alaska Beyond, offers a variety of movies, TV shows, music, and games. They also have a selection of free entertainment options, including movies and TV shows.
4. **JetBlue Airways**: JetBlue's in-flight entertainment system, Fly-Fi, offers live TV, movies, and TV shows, as well as a selection of games and music. They also offer free Wi-Fi on all flights.
5. **United Airlines**: United's in-flight entertainment system, United Private Screening, offers a wide selection of movies, TV shows, music, and games. They also have a mobile app that allows you to stream content to your personal device.

All of these airlines have generally good reputations for their in-flight entertainment systems, but it's always a good idea to check reviews and ratings from other passengers to get a more accurate picture.
